text:
I was offered equity … happy to chat privately if you want to compare apples to apples. 

I look at it similar to <@U01ER4GNRJ7> … icing on the cake. But not part of total comp like salary, bonus, and profit sharing.

text:
Hi everyone,

I often face a dilemma: I have 9 years experience in SEM and can pretty much get work in this area if I go for it. I am currently freelancing for this type of role for money. However, I have also been working as a freelance copywriter for the last 2 years.

Until recently I worked as a content specialist/freelance copywriter for a startup but they ran out of money. I haven´t been able to get consistent work as a copywriter or content specialist (sometimes those have overlapped a bit?), so sometimes I also take SEM jobs. Deep down I am tired of SEM (although it does involve some writing) and I have a passion for writing and content all things related. I have been doing good jobs I think with some content training from LinkedIn and other sources and would love to grow a career on it, but I need money.

Do I keep on working on SEM jobs to make money while I try to capture clients? What are the best sources and tactics to capture clients? I can write both in Spanish and English. I´m Spanish and live in Spain: do you think I can work within the US market?

Thanks for reading and sorry if I threw on too many ideas at once.

text: Hello! Not all of our members are guys. In an effort to be more conscious of the language we use to address each other, why not try “Hey, folks,” or “Hey everyone” instead?
Manager/editor-in-chief sounds like my dream role. I’ll look into people managing skills I can pick up! Anything but dealing with customer service-type bodies.

user_profile.real_name: Brit McGinnis (editing, copy, horror movie recs)
user_profile.name: britmcginnis
